name: Ampharos
Ability1Text: Each Pokémon that has any damage counters on it (both yours and your opponent's) can't use any Poké-Powers.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 damage plus 30 more damage. If tails, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.
Attack2Text: Move an Energy card attached to Ampharos to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

name: Blastoise
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may look at the top 3 cards of your deck, choose as many Water Energy cards as you like, and attach them to your Pokémon in any way you like. Discard the other cards. This power can't be used if Blastoise is affected by a Special Condition.
Attack1Text: Does 20 damage plus 10 more damage for each Energy attached to all Pokémon (both yours and your opponent's).
Attack2Text: Discard 2 Energy attached to Blastoise. Choose 2 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. This attack does 60 damage to each of them. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) Blastoise can't use Double Launcher during your next turn.

name: Blaziken
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may choose 1 of the Defending Pokémon. That Pokémon is now Burned. This power can't be used if Blaziken is affected by a Special Condition.
Attack1Text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.
Attack2Text: Discard 2 Energy attached to Blaziken.

name: Delcatty
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your discard pile for up to 2 basic Energy cards, show them to your opponent, and put those cards on top of your deck in any order. If you do, put 2 damage counters on Delcatty. This power can't be used if Delcatty is affected by a Special Condition.
Attack1Text: Does 10 damage plus 10 more damage for each damage counter on Delcatty. Then, remove 2 damage counters from Delcatty.

name: Dialga
flavorText: It has the power to control time. It appears in Sinnoh-region myths as an ancient deity.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn, when you put Dialga from your hand onto your Bench, you may search your discard pile for up to 3 in any combination of Pokémon (excluding Pokémon LV.X) and basic Energy cards. Show them to your opponent and put them on top of your deck in any order.
Attack1Text: Draw cards until you have 7 cards in your hand.

name: Dialga
flavorText: It has the power to control time. It appears in Sinnoh-region myths as an ancient deity.
Ability1Text: As long as Dialga is your Active Pokémon, your opponent can't play any Pokémon from his or her hand to evolve his or her Active Pokémon.
Attack1Text: Discard all Metal Energy attached to Dialga.

name: Dialga G
Attack1Text: Your opponent can't play any Trainer cards or Stadium cards from his or her hand during your opponent's next turn.
Attack2Text: If the Defending Pokémon already has 2 or more damage counters on it, this attack does 50 damage plus 20 more damage.

name: Gardevoir
Ability1Text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), you may move a Psychic Energy attached to 1 of your Benched Pokémon to your Active Pokémon. This power can't be used if Gardevoir is affected by a Special Condition.
Attack1Text: Does 20 damage plus 10 more damage for each Energy attached to Gardevoir and the Defending Pokémon.
Attack2Text: Gardevoir has no Weakness during your opponent's next turn.

name: Giratina
Ability1Text: Once during your turn, when you put Giratina from your hand onto your Bench, you may use this power. Each player shuffles his or her hand into his or her deck and draws up to 4 cards. (You draw your cards first.)
Attack1Text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

name: Giratina
Attack1Text: This attack does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon).
Attack2Text: Choose 1 card from your opponent's hand without looking. Look at the card you chose, then have your opponent shuffle that card into his or her deck.

name: Manectric
Ability1Text: Prevent all damage done to your Benched Pokémon (excluding any Manectric) by attacks.
Attack1Text: This attack does 30 damage to each Pokémon that has any Poké-Powers (both yours and your opponent's). (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)
Attack2Text: Search your deck for a Lightning Energy card and attach it to 1 of your Pokémon. Shuffle your deck afterward.

name: Palkia G
Attack1Text: You may switch Palkia G with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.
Attack2Text: Does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

name: Rampardos
Ability1Text: Rampardos's attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance, Poké-Powers, Poké-Bodies, or any other effects on the Defending Pokémon.
Attack1Text: If the Defending Pokémon would be Knocked Out by this attack, Rampardos does 40 damage to itself.
Attack2Text: Any damage done to Rampardos by attacks is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance) until the end of your next turn.

name: Shaymin
flavorText: It lives in flower patches and avoids detection by curling up to look like a flowering plant.
Attack1Text: Remove 2 damage counters from Shaymin. The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.
Attack2Text: If the Defending Pokémon is affected by a Special Condition, this attack does 30 damage plus 50 more damage. Then, remove all Special Conditions from the Defending Pokémon.

name: Shaymin
flavorText: The flowers all over its body burst into bloom if it is lovingly hugged and senses gratitude.
Attack1Text: Attach a Grass Energy card from your hand to Shaymin.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If tails, discard an Energy attached to Shaymin.

name: Slaking
flavorText: The world's laziest Pokémon. When it is lounging, it is actually saving energy for striking back.
Ability1Text: If Slaking used any attacks during your last turn, Slaking can't attack.
Attack1Text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done to Slaking by attacks is increased by 50 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

name: Weavile G
Attack1Text: Search your deck for up to 2 basic Pokémon SP and put them onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward.
Attack2Text: Does 10 damage plus 10 more damage for each Pokémon SP you have in play.

name: Altaria
Attack1Text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.
Attack2Text: If the Defending Pokémon is Asleep and was damaged or affected by Midnight Eyes during your last turn, the Defending Pokémon is Knocked Out.

name: Banette
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may discard as many cards as you like from your hand. If you do, put that many damage counters on Banette. This power can't be used if Banette is affected by a Special Condition.
Attack1Text: Discard an Energy card attached to Banette, and then switch all damage counters on Banette with those on the Defending Pokémon. (If an effect of this attack is prevented, this attack does nothing.)
Attack2Text: You may show your hand to your opponent. If you do and if you don't have any Pokémon in your hand, this attack does 30 damage plus 30 more damage.

name: Bastiodon
Ability1Text: As long as Bastiodon has a Pokémon Tool attached to it, remove 1 damage counter from Bastiodon between turns.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of an attack, including damage, done to Bastiodon during your opponent's next turn.
Attack2Text: Bastiodon does 30 damage to itself.

name: Beautifly
flavorText: Despite its looks, it is aggressive. It jabs with its long, thin mouth if disturbed while collecting pollen.
Attack1Text: If Beautifly has 2 or less Energy attached to it, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned. If Beautifly has 3 Energy attached to it, the Defending Pokémon is now Burned and Poisoned. If Beautifly has 4 or more Energy attached to it, this attack does 20 damage plus 40 more damage and the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep, Burned, and Poisoned.
Attack2Text: If the Defending Pokémon has any Resistance, this attack's base damage is 60 damage instead of 30.

name: Blissey
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may discard a card from your hand. If you do, remove 2 damage counters from 1 of your Pokémon. You can't use more than 1 Nurse Call Poké-Power each turn. This power can't be used if Blissey is affected by a Special Condition.
Attack1Text: Draw cards until you have 6 cards in your hand.
Attack2Text: Blissey does 60 damage to itself.

name: Dialga
flavorText: A legendary Pokémon of Sinnoh. It is said that time flows when Dialga's heart beats.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, search your discard pile for a basic Energy card and attach it to Dialga.
Attack2Text: Dialga can't attack during your next turn.

name: Dugtrio
Ability1Text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon retreats, put 2 damage counters on that Pokémon.
Attack1Text: Your opponent switches the Defending Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon.
Attack2Text: Does 10 damage to each Benched Pokémon (both yours and your opponent's). (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

name: Dustox
Ability1Text: Prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to Dustox by your opponent's Pokémon that is affected by 2 or more Special Conditions.
Attack1Text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned. If the Defending Pokémon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack does nothing.
Attack2Text: If the Defending Pokémon has any Poké-Powers or Poké-Bodies, the Defending Pokémon is now Burned and Confused.

name: Empoleon
flavorText: If anyone were to hurt its pride, it would slash them with wings that can cleave through an ice floe.
Attack1Text: Choose 1 card from your opponent's hand without looking and discard it.
Attack2Text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 70 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) Empoleon can't use Jet Smash during your next turn.

name: Giratina
flavorText: A Pokémon that is said to live in a world on the reverse side of ours. It appears in an ancient cemetery.
Attack1Text: You may switch Giratina with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.
Attack2Text: If the Defending Pokémon is Knocked Out by this attack, put the Defending Pokémon and all cards attached to in the Lost Zone instead of the discard pile.

name: Giratina
flavorText: It was banished for its violence. It silently gazed upon the old world from the Distortion World.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

name: Golduck
flavorText: It is seen swimming dynamically and elegantly using its well-developed limbs and flippers.
Attack1Text: If your opponent has any Water Energy attached to any of his or her Pokémon, you may do 30 damage to any 1 Benched Pokémon instead. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)
Attack2Text: You may move all Energy cards attached to Golduck to 1 of your Benched Pokémon. If you do, this attack does 40 damage plus 20 more damage.

name: Gyarados G
Attack1Text: Flip a coin for each of your opponent's Pokémon. If that coin flip is heads, this attack does 30 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)
Attack2Text: Does 100 damage minus 10 damage for each damage counter on Gyarados G.

name: Infernape
flavorText: It uses unique fighting moves with fires on its hands and feet. It will take on any opponent.
Attack1Text: Discard as many Fire Energy cards as you like attached to your Pokémon in play. Flip a coin for each Energy card you discarded. This attack does 80 damage times the number of heads.
Attack2Text: Does 30 damage plus 10 more damage for each damage counter on Infernape.

name: Kricketune
flavorText: There is a village that hosts a contest based on the amazingly variable cries of this Pokémon.
Attack1Text: Does 20 damage times the number of Kricketot and Kricketune in your discard pile.
Attack2Text: If the Defending Pokémon is Asleep, this attack does 50 damage plus 30 more damage. Remove the Special Condition Asleep from the Defending Pokémon.

name: Lickilicky
flavorText: The long tongue is always soggy with slobber. The saliva contains a solvent that causes numbness.
Attack1Text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 40 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) Before doing damage, discard all Trainer cards attached to that Pokémon.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed and discard an Energy card attached to the Defending Pokémon.

name: Ludicolo
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may use this power. If you do, your turn ends. During your next turn, each of Ludicolo's attacks does 60 more damage to the Defending Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance). This power can't be used if Ludicolo is affected by a Special Condition.
Attack1Text: The Defending Pokémon is now Confused.
Attack2Text: After doing damage, remove from Ludicolo the number of damage counters equal to the damage you did to the Defending Pokémon. Ludicolo can't use Best Dance during your next turn.

name: Luvdisc
flavorText: It lives in warm seas. It is said that a couple finding this Pokémon will be blessed with eternal love.
Attack1Text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. Search your deck for a Pokémon that is the same type as the Pokémon you chose, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.
Attack2Text: Your opponent may draw a card.

name: Ninetales
flavorText: Its nine tails are said to be imbued with a mystic power. It can live for a thousand years.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin until you get tails. Search your deck for a number of basic Fire Energy cards up to the number of heads and attach them to any of your Pokémon in any way you like. Shuffle your deck afterward.
Attack2Text: If you have more Energy in play than your opponent, the Defending Pokémon is now Burned and Confused.

name: Palkia
flavorText: A legendary Pokémon of Sinnoh. It is said that space becomes more stable with PALKIA's every breath.
Attack1Text: Does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

name: Shaymin
flavorText: It lives in flower patches and avoids detection by curling up to look like a flowering plant.
Attack1Text: Does 10 damage plus 10 more damage for each Energy attached to Shaymin.
Attack2Text: Remove 2 damage counters from each of your Pokémon.

name: Torterra
flavorText: Some Pokémon are born on a TORTERRA's back and spend their entire life there.
Attack1Text: Does 40 damage plus 10 more damage for each Grass Energy attached to all of your Pokémon.
Attack2Text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

name: Toxicroak G
Ability1Text: Prevent all effects of attacks, excluding damage, done to Toxicroak G.
Attack1Text: If the Defending Pokémon is Poisoned, this attack does 20 damage plus 40 more damage.

name: Bronzong G
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may move an Energy card attached to 1 of your Pokémon SP to another of your Pokémon. Then, put 2 damage counters on Bronzong G. This power can't be used if Bronzong G is affected by a Special Condition.
Attack1Text: Does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon that has any damage counters on it. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

name: Cacturne
flavorText: It becomes active at night, seeking prey that is exhausted from the day's desert heat.
Attack1Text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon that has any damage counters on it. This attack does 50 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)
Attack2Text: You may discard a Grass or Darkness Energy attached to Cacturne. If you discard a Grass Energy, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned. If you discard a Darkness Energy, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

name: Carnivine
Attack1Text: Choose 2 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. This attack does 10 damage to each of them. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)
Attack2Text: Remove 2 damage counters from Carnivine.

name: Cascoon
flavorText: It never forgets any attack it endured while in the cocoon. After evolution, it seeks payback.
Attack1Text: Search your deck for a card that evolves from Cascoon and put it onto Cascoon. (This counts as evolving Cascoon.) Shuffle your deck afterward.
Attack2Text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

name: Combusken
flavorText: Its kicking mastery lets it loose 10 kicks per second. It emits sharp cries to intimidate foes.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 20 more damage.

name: Cranidos
flavorText: A lifelong jungle dweller from 100 million years ago, it would snap obstructing trees with head butts.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 20 more damage.
Attack2Text: You may discard any Stadium card in play.

name: Crobat G
Ability1Text: Once during your turn, when you put Crobat G from your hand onto your Bench, you may put 1 damage counter on 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.
Attack1Text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned. Put 2 damage counters instead of 1 on the Defending Pokémon between turns.

name: Flaaffy
flavorText: If its coat becomes fully charged with electricity, its tail lights up. It fires hair that zaps on impact.
Attack1Text: Does 10 damage to 2 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)
Attack2Text: Move an Energy card attached to the Defending Pokémon to another of your opponent's Pokémon.

name: Grotle
flavorText: It knows where pure water wells up. It carries fellow Pokémon there on its back.
Attack1Text: Remove 1 damage counter from Grotle.

name: Houndoom G
Attack1Text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat or use any Poké-Powers during your opponent's next turn.
Attack2Text: You may discard a Darkness Energy attached to Houndoom G. If you do, this attack does 40 damage plus 20 more damage.

name: Kirlia
flavorText: If its Trainer becomes happy, it overflows with energy, dancing joyously while spinning about.
Attack1Text: You may switch Kirlia with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

name: Lombre
flavorText: It has a mischievous spirit. If it spots an angler, it will tug on the fishing line to interfere.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, look at your opponent's hand and choose 1 card, then have your opponent shuffle that card into his or her deck.

name: Lucario
flavorText: A well-trained one can sense auras to identify and take in the feelings of creatures over half a mile away.
Attack1Text: Does 10 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)
Attack2Text: Does 20 damage plus 10 more damage for each of your Benched Pokémon.

name: Mightyena
Ability1Text: If Mightyena is affected by a Special Condition, ignore all Energy necessary to use Mightyena's attacks.
Attack1Text: If you played any Supporter card from your hand during this turn, this attack does 20 damage plus 20 more damage.
Attack2Text: If Mightyena has less Energy attached to it than the Defending Pokémon, this attack does 50 damage plus 30 more damage.

name: Mismagius
flavorText: Its cry sounds like an incantation. It is said the cry may rarely be imbued with happiness-giving power.
Attack1Text: Choose 1 of the Defending Pokémon's attacks. That Pokémon can't use that attack during your opponent's next turn.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

name: Monferno
flavorText: It skillfully control the intensity of the fire on its tail to keep its foes at an ideal distance.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If tails, discard a Fire Energy attached to Monferno.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

name: Muk
Ability1Text: If Muk remains affected by any Special Conditions between turns, remove 2 damage counters from Muk.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned. If tails, Muk is now Poisoned.
Attack2Text: If Muk is Poisoned, this attack does 50 damage plus 20 more damage and the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

name: Octillery
flavorText: It loves to lurk inside holes in rocks. It sometimes sprays ink on prey by sticking out only its mouth.
Attack1Text: Reveal the top 5 cards of your deck. Flip a coin for each Energy card you find there. This attack does 50 damage times the number of heads. Shuffle the revealed cards back into your deck.
Attack2Text: Any time the Defending Pokémon tries to attack, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack does nothing. (If the Defending Pokémon is no longer your opponent's Active Pokémon, this effect ends.)

name: Prinplup
flavorText: Because every PRINPLUP considers itself to be the most important, they can never form a group.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

name: Probopass
flavorText: It freely controls three small units called Mini-Noses using magnetic force.
Attack1Text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 30 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy card attached to the Defending Pokémon.

name: Seviper
Attack1Text: Remove 4 damage counters from Seviper.
Attack2Text: You may switch Seviper with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

name: Shieldon
flavorText: It is outstandingly armored. As a result, it can eat grass and berries without having to fight.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, during your opponent's next turn, if Shieldon would be Knocked Out by damage from an attack, Shieldon is not Knocked Out and its remaining HP becomes 10 instead.
Attack2Text: Does 10 damage to 2 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

name: Silcoon
flavorText: It wraps silk around the branches of a tree. It drinks rainwater on its silk while awaiting evolution.
Attack1Text: Search your deck for a card that evolves from Silcoon and put it onto Silcoon. (This counts as evolving Silcoon.) Shuffle your deck afterward.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

name: Vigoroth
flavorText: Its heart beats at a tenfold tempo, so it cannot sit still even for a moment.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If tails, Vigoroth does 10 damage to itself.
Attack2Text: If Vigoroth has any damage counters on it, this attack does 50 damage plus 20 more damage.

name: Wartortle
flavorText: It is said to live 10,000 years. Its furry tail is popular as a symbol of longevity.
Attack1Text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.
Attack2Text: Wartortle does 10 damage to itself. Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all damage done to Wartortle by attacks during your opponent's next turn.

name: Zangoose
Ability1Text: Zangoose can't be affected by any Special Conditions.
Attack1Text: Switch the Defending Pokémon with 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. This attack does 20 damage to the new Defending Pokémon.
Attack2Text: Does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon that has any damage counters on it. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

name: Cacnea
flavorText: By storing water in its body, this desert dweller can survive 30 days without water.
Attack1Text: If Cacnea has any Darkness Energy attached to it, this attack does 10 damage plus 10 more damage.
Attack2Text: Flip 2 coins. For each heads, choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon and this attack does 10 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) (You can choose the same Pokémon more than once, but you can't do more than 10 damage to that Pokémon in this way.)

name: Carnivine
flavorText: It binds itself to trees in marshes. It attracts prey with its sweet-smelling drool and gulps them down.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.
Attack2Text: Remove 1 damage counter from each of your Benched Pokémon.

name: Chansey
flavorText: A kindly Pokémon that lays highly nutritious eggs and shares them with injured Pokémon or people.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, remove 3 damage counters from Chansey. If tails, remove 3 damage counters from the Defending Pokémon.
Attack2Text: If the Defending Pokémon already has any damage counters on it, this attack's base damage is 10 instead of 40.

name: Chimchar
flavorText: It is very agile. Before going to sleep, it extinguishes the flame on its tail to prevent fires.

name: Combee
flavorText: The trio is together from birth. It constantly gathers honey from flowers to please VESPIQUEN.
Attack1Text: Draw a card.
Attack2Text: Does 10 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

name: Diglett
flavorText: A Pokémon that lives underground. Because of its dark habitat, it is repelled by bright sunlight.
Attack1Text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. This attack does 10 damage to that Pokémon. This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness or Resistance.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 20 more damage.

name: Dunsparce
flavorText: It digs into the ground with its tail and makes a mazelike nest. It can fly just a little.
Attack1Text: Search your deck for a Basic Pokémon and put it onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward.
Attack2Text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. This attack does 10 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

name: Electrike
flavorText: Using electricity stored in its fur, it stimulates its muscles to heighten its reaction speed.
Attack1Text: Your opponent switches the Defending Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

name: Grimer
flavorText: It was born when sludge in a dirty stream was exposed to the moon's X-rays. It appears among filth.
Attack1Text: Search your deck for Grimer and put it onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward.
Attack2Text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

name: Happiny
flavorText: It likes to carry around a small rock. It may wander around others' feet and cause them to stumble.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may put Chansey from your hand onto Happiny (this counts as evolving Happiny) and remove all damage counters from Happiny.
Attack1Text: Switch the Defending Pokémon with 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. Remove 2 damage counters from the new Defending Pokémon.

name: Honchkrow G
Attack1Text: Search your deck for up to 2 in any combination of Stadium cards or Trainer cards that has Team Galactic's Invention in its name, show them to your opponent, and put them into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.
Attack2Text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 20 damage to that Pokémon. If that Pokémon already has any damage counters on it, this attack does 20 damage plus 20 more damage. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

name: Kricketot
flavorText: Its legs are short. Whenever it stumbles, its stiff antennae clack with a xylophone-like sound.
Attack1Text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

name: Lapras
flavorText: It loves crossing the sea with people and Pokémon on its back. It understands human speech.
Attack1Text: Does 10 damage times the amount of Energy attached to Lapras.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

name: Lickitung
flavorText: When it extends its over-six-foot-long tongue, its tail quivers. There is a possibility they are connected.
Attack1Text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 10 damage to that Pokémon. This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness or Resistance.
Attack2Text: Choose 1 card from your opponent's hand without looking and discard it.

name: Lotad
flavorText: It looks like an aquatic plant and serves as a ferry to Pokémon that can't swim.
Attack1Text: Does 10 damage plus 10 more damage for each Energy attached to Lotad but not used to pay for this attack's Energy cost. You can't add more than 20 damage in this way.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, search your deck for a Grass Energy card and attach it to 1 of your Pokémon. Shuffle your deck afterward.

name: Mareep
flavorText: Its fluffy coat swells to double when static electricity builds up. Touching it can be shocking.
Attack1Text: Search your deck for a basic Energy card, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.
Attack2Text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done to Mareep by attacks is reduced by 10 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

name: Misdreavus
flavorText: A Pokémon that startles people in the middle of the night. It gathers fear as its energy.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, search your discard pile for a Trainer card, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand.

name: Nosepass
flavorText: When endangered, it may protect itself by raising its magnetism and drawing iron objects to its body.
Attack1Text: Switch the Defending Pokémon with 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon.

name: Piplup
flavorText: A poor walker, it often falls down. However, its strong pride makes it puff up its chest without a care.
Attack1Text: Does 10 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

name: Poochyena
flavorText: A Pokémon with persistent nature, it chases its prey until the prey becomes exhausted.
Attack1Text: Search your deck for Poochyena and put it onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

name: Psyduck
flavorText: Overwhelmed by enigmatic abilities, it suffers a constant headache. It sometimes uses mysterious powers.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent can't play any Trainer, Supporter, or Stadium cards from his or her hand during his or her next turn.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does no damage to the Defending Pokémon. Instead, Psyduck is now Confused.

name: Purugly G
Attack1Text: If your opponent has 6 or more cards in his or her hand, discard a number of cards without looking until your opponent has 5 cards left in his or her hand.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 50 damage plus 30 more damage and Purugly G is now Asleep.

name: Ralts
flavorText: If its horns capture the warm feelings of people or Pokémon, its body warms up slightly.
Attack1Text: Look at the top 5 cards in either player's deck and put them back on top of that player's deck in any order.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

name: Remoraid
flavorText: It forcefully squirts water. The water jet never misses prey even if the REMORAID is deep in the sea.
Attack2Text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

name: Riolu
flavorText: It has the peculiar power of being able to see emotions such as joy and rage in the form of waves.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 10 more damage.

name: Shuppet
flavorText: It loves vengeful emotions and hangs in rows under the eaves of houses where vengeful people live.
Attack1Text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.
Attack2Text: Return Shuppet and all cards attached to it to your hand. (If you don't have any Benched Pokémon, this attack does nothing.)

name: Skitty
flavorText: It can't stop itself from chasing moving things, and it runs in a circle, chasing its own tail.
Attack1Text: Remove 1 damage counter from each of your Pokémon.
Attack2Text: Skitty does 10 damage to itself.

name: Skuntank G
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if you have a Stadium card in play, you may use this power. Each Active Pokémon (both yours and your opponent's) (excluding Pokémon SP) is now Poisoned. This power can't be used if Skuntank is affected by a Special Condition.
Attack1Text: If the Defending Pokémon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

name: Slakoth
flavorText: It spends nearly all its time in a day sprawled out. Just seeing it makes one drowsy.
Attack1Text: Does 10 damage times the number of damage counters on Slakoth.
Attack2Text: Remove all damage counters from Slakoth. Slakoth can't attack during your next turn.

name: Squirtle
flavorText: It shelters itself in its shell, then strikes back with spouts of water at every opportunity.

name: Swablu
flavorText: It can't relax if it or its surroundings are not clean. It wipes off dirt with its wings.
Attack1Text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.
Attack2Text: You may switch Swablu with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

name: Tauros
flavorText: Once it takes aim at its foe, it makes a headlong charge. It is famous for its violent nature.
Attack1Text: Search your deck for a basic Energy card, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If tails, Tauros does 10 damage to itself.

name: Torchic
flavorText: A fire burns inside, so it feels very warm to hug. It launches fireballs of 1,800 degrees F.
Attack1Text: During your next turn, Torchic's Fire Shard attack's base damage is 80.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

name: Torkoal
flavorText: It burns coal inside its shell for energy. It blows out black soot if it is endangered.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Burned.
Attack2Text: Move an Energy card attached to Torkoal to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

name: Turtwig
flavorText: The shell on its back is made of soil. On a very healthy TURTWIG, the shell should feel moist.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

name: Vulpix
flavorText: It controls balls of fire. As it grows, its six tails split from their tips to make more tails.
Attack1Text: Discard up to 2 Energy cards from your hand. For each card you discarded, draw 2 cards.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

name: Wurmple
flavorText: Often targeted by bird Pokémon, it desperately resists by releasing poison from its tail spikes.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

name: Team Galactic's Invention G-101 Energy Gain
Team Galactic's Invention G-103 Power Spray
Team Galactic's Invention G-105 Poké Turn
Armor Fossil
Ability1Text: Whenever Armor Fossil would be damaged by your opponent's attack, flip a coin until you get tails. For each heads, reduce that damage by 10.

name: Skull Fossil
Ability1Text: During your opponent's turn, if Skull Fossil would be Knocked Out by damage from an opponent's attack, flip a coin until you get tails. For each heads, put 1 damage counter on the Attacking Pokémon.

name: Dialga G LV.X
Ability1Text: Each Pokémon (both yours and your opponent's) (excluding Pokémon SP) can't use any Poké-Bodies.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin until you get tails. For each heads, remove an Energy card attached to the Defending Pokémon and put it in the Lost Zone.

name: Drapion LV.X
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may flip a coin. If heads, choose 1 of the Defending Pokémon. That Pokémon is now Poisoned. Put 3 damage counters instead of 1 on that Pokémon between turns. This power can't be used if Drapion is affected by a Special Condition.
Attack1Text: Does 40 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

name: Giratina LV.X
Ability1Text: Whenever your opponent's Pokémon tries to attack, your opponent discards 1 card from his or her hand. (If your opponent can't discard 1 card, your opponent's Pokémon can't attack.) You can't use more than 1 Invisible Tentacles Poké-Body each turn.
Attack1Text: This attack does 30 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) If any of your opponent's Pokémon would be Knocked Out by damage from this attack, put that Pokémon and all cards attached to it in the Lost Zone instead of discarding it.

name: Palkia G LV.X
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may use this power. Any player who has 4 or more Benched Pokémon chooses 3 of his or her Benched Pokémon. Put the other Benched Pokémon and all cards attached to them in the Lost Zone. (You choose your Pokémon first.) This power can't be used it Palkia G is affected by a Special Condition.
Attack1Text: Discard 2 Energy attached to Palkia G. Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 80 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

name: Shaymin LV.X
Ability1Text: Each of your Grass Pokémon (excluding any Shaymin) gets +40 HP. You can't use more than 1 Thankfulness Poké-Body each turn.
Attack1Text: Choose as many Grass Energy cards from your hand as you like and attach them to your Pokémon in any way you like. If you do, this attack does 40 damage plus 20 more damage for each Grass Energy attached in this way.

name: Shaymin LV.X
Ability1Text: If any of your Grass Pokémon were Knocked Out by damage from an opponent's attack during his or her last turn, each of Shaymin's attacks does 60 more damage to the Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).
Attack1Text: You may move any number of Energy cards attached to your Pokémon to your other Pokémon in any way you like.

name: Electabuzz
flavorText: It loves to feed on strong electricity. It occasionally appears around large power plants and so on.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 damage plus 10 more damage. If tails, Electabuzz does 10 damage to itself.

name: Hitmonchan
flavorText: The spirit of a pro boxer has infused this POKéMON. It throws punches that are faster than a bullet train.

name: Scyther
flavorText: It tears and shreds prey with its wickedly sharp scythes. It very rarely spreads its wings to fly.
Attack1Text: During your next turn, Scyther's Slash attack's base damage is 60.

name: Lotad
Ability1Text: If Lotad has any Water Energy attached to it, Lotad's Retreat Cost is 0.
Attack1Text: Remove 1 damage counter from Lotad.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 20 more damage.

name: Swablu
Attack1Text: Remove 4 damage counters from Swablu. Swablu can't retreat during your next turn.
Attack2Text: If Swablu was damaged by an attack during your opponent's last turn, this attack does the same amount of damage done to Swablu to the Defending Pokémon.

name: Vulpix
Attack1Text: Search your deck for up to 2 Fire Energy cards, show them to your opponent, and put them in your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.
Attack2Text: Does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Grass Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)
